title: Movado Men's 0606502 Museum Stainless Steel Watch with Black Leather Band
description:
The iconic Movado Museum single dot dial looks right at home in this simple yet bold timepiece. The black dial with matching leather band look great on the polished stainless steel case.   Evoke the minimalist spirit of sophisticated elegance with this luxury Movado timepiece. In signature Movado style, the single dot at the 12 o' clock position plays brilliantly against a black backdrop of the dark dial and black leather band. An upscale watch that adds without subtracting, spring for this Movado.   
  The art of Movado is the art of design. Since its founding in 1881 by 19-year old entrepreneur Achille Ditesheim in the village of La Chaux-de-Fonds, Switzerland, Movado has achieved a legacy of design innovation, earning more than 100 patents and 200 international awards for artistry and innovation in watch design and time technology.Movado, meaning "always in motion" in the international language of Esperanto, is the hallmark of some of the most famous timepieces ever created: the 1912 Polyplan, its revolutionary, patented movement constructed on three planes to fit a case curved to follow the wrist…the WWI Soldier’s Watch with its elegant, protective grill…the 1927 Ermeto, a capsule-shaped pocket watch wound by the sliding motion of its case…the innovative 1950’s Kingmatic series of rotor-driven automatics…the Movado Artist’s Series by luminaries of the fine art world…and the Movado Museum® Watch with its legendary dial.Defined by a single dot at 12 representing the sun at high noon, the Museum Watch dial is regarded as an icon of Modernism. It was designed by Bauhaus-influenced artist Nathan George Horwitt in 1947.
